About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

I have over 6 years of experience as a design engineer, and have worked for most of that time at Warsaw Institute of Aviation (WIA) for GE Oil & Gas (currently BHGE) in the centrifugal compressor team. While I get most of my experience in mechanical and aero design of centrifugal compressor I have also been involved in tasks that required some programming knowledge. I started with simple VBA macros in excel, went through advanced VBA with callouts for external scripts and finished with tool that combined the VBA excel tool with HYSYS process simulation software. My most recent work include development of performance analytics for reciprocating compressor using Python.

College

B.Sc/M.Sc. Alumni

I graduated from University of Science and Technology in Krakow (AGH) for both my B.Sc. (2011) and M.Sc. (2013) in Power Engineering. During my 5 years at collage I have been involved in numerous extra curriculum activities such as participation (and co-creation!) of science club - Ignis - at the department of Energy and Fuels.

Current position

Lead Engineer

I am currently involved in work around the design of centrifugal compressors and expanders for various applications (O&G in most cases). I've taken part in several NPI (New Product Introduction) projects for new types of compressor units - for example HPRC (High Pressure Ratio Compressor).

Aditional work

Software Engineer

My software engineer work is partially related to current job - I have been the creator of performance prediction tool for new type of compressor (VBA excel tool with HYSYS callouts). More recently I have also been involved in co-creation of reciprocating compressors analytics using Python. I also consider software engineering my hobby and work on my own projects (this portfolio page for example) and take part in competitions (Halite 3). Most recently I've been working on simple Lua games (check "My Work").
